line_1: Haud up thy han' Deil! ance, twice, thrice!
line_2: Thae curst horse-leeches o' th' Excise,

line_1: Haud up thy han' Deil! ance, twice, thrice!
line_2: Wha mak the Whisky stells their prize!

line_1: Haud up thy han' Deil! ance, twice, thrice!
line_2: An' bake them up in brunstane pies

line_1: Then gently tapt her elbow thrice,
line_2: He chang'd his figure in a trice,

line_1: Cold was the hand which touch'd her thrice;
line_2: And hollow was the trembling voice,

line_1: For THRICE She knock'd, and THRICE, and THRICE.
line_2: HE said, no need to say it twice,

line_1: It chanc'd the Stack he faddom't thrice,
line_2: They hoy't out Will, wi' sair advice;

line_1: Because he gat the toom dish thrice,
line_2: Auld, uncle John, wha wedlock's joys,

line_1: Some stammer'd on the toom ane thrice,
line_2: The dishes then, by joint advice,
